meanings.definition: The main axis or stem of an inflorescence or compound leaf.
meanings.sent1: The rachis of the leaf supports all the smaller leaflets.
meanings.sent2: The gardener carefully trimmed the rachis of the plant to promote healthy growth.
meanings.sent3: The rachis of the flower decided to take a break and let the petals do all the work.
meanings.sent4: The rachis of the tree stood tall and proud, bearing the weight of the entire canopy.
meanings.sent5: As the wind blew, the rachis swayed gracefully, showcasing the beauty of nature's design.

meanings.definition: A ridge or groove on the surface of an organism.
meanings.sent1: The scientist observed the rachis on the insect's exoskeleton under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The hiker noticed a strange rachis running along the back of the lizard.
meanings.sent3: The rachis on the tree bark seemed to be playing hide and seek with the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: The rachis on the seashell resembled a delicate pattern etched by nature's hand.
meanings.sent5: The rachis on the rock formation added a unique texture to the landscape.
